story:
Once upon a time, in a land far away, there lived a little Iranian girl named Sara. Sara was a kind and curious soul, always eager to explore the world around her. One night, as she lay in bed, her mother came to tuck her in and noticed that Sara seemed a bit sad.

"What's wrong, my dear?" her mother asked softly.

Sara let out a sigh and replied, "I wish I could fly like a bird and see the world from high above."

Her mother smiled and began to tell her a magical bedtime story:

"Once, there was a magical carpet known as the Persian Dreamweaver. It was said that anyone who flew on this carpet would be able to see the world in all its beauty and wonder."

Sara's eyes sparkled with excitement as she listened intently to her mother's words. Her mother continued, "One night, the Persian Dreamweaver appeared outside Sara's window, shimmering in the moonlight. Without hesitation, Sara climbed aboard and felt the carpet lift off the ground."

As the carpet soared through the starlit sky, Sara gazed down at the twinkling lights below. She saw the majestic mountains of Iran, the lush green valleys, and the ancient cities filled with history and culture.

The Persian Dreamweaver took her on a magical journey, showing her the beauty of her homeland from a new perspective. Sara felt her heart fill with joy and wonder as she flew through the night sky, feeling like she was a part of something greater than herself.

When the journey was over, the carpet gently landed back outside Sara's window. She climbed off with a smile on her face, grateful for the experience she had just had. Her mother tucked her back into bed, and Sara drifted off to sleep with dreams of new adventures and endless possibilities.

And so, dear Sara, remember that even though you may not be able to fly like a bird, your imagination can take you anywhere you want to go. Keep dreaming, keep exploring, and never forget the magic that lies within you."

With those words, Sara's mother kissed her goodnight, and Sara fell into a peaceful slumber, filled with dreams of flying high on the Persian Dreamweaver.

The end. Goodnight, sweet Sara. May your dreams take you to wonderful places.
